messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: What's the correlation between police funds and violent-crime trends?  Using the 10 most populous U.S. cities from the 2020 Census, list each city’s FY 2024 police-department budget (USD bn, keep one digit). Include sworn police officer headcounts in 2024, the 2023 violent-crime rate (per 100k residents), the 2023 Homicides (per 100k residents) and the 2024 mayor and his/her party. If a city uses a calendar-year budget, treat the 2024 calendar budget as FY 2024. Fill missing values with NA.
The crime rates and homicides should be rounded up to the nearest integer.

Please output one Markdown table with the columns in this order:
 City | FY 2024 Police Budget (USD bn) | Sworn Officers | 2023 Violent-Crime Rate | 2023 Homicides | 2024 Mayor | Party | Population (2020 Census)

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To find the correlation between police funds and violent-crime trends for the top 10 most populous U.S. cities, I need to gather the specific data on budgets, officer counts, crime rates, homicides, and mayors. Let's start with finding these details:

<search>top 10 most populous US cities FY 2024 police department budget USD billion</search>

Search query: top 10 most populous US cities FY 2024 police department budget USD billion
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.statista.com/chart/10593/how-much-do-us-cities-spend-on-policing/?srsltid=AfmBOoqL1QRwZHfUCPmHgeBhXWfET7pVHxaM85t2K6RRpRBYLh2HWcgN):
Chart: How Much Do U.S. Cities Spend On Policing? | Statista According to the data, 65 out of the nation's 300 largest cities spend 40 percent or more of their general budgets on policing. Memphis is among ...

[Doc 2](https://www.reddit.com/r/dataisbeautiful/comments/1c8wtyn/oc_the_most_populated_city_in_each_state_and_its/):
[OC] The Most Populated City In Each State And It's 2024 City Budget NYC has a population of 8.3 million with a $38 Billion budget. Adjusting for school taxes is one of the challenges comparing municipal spending ...

[Doc 3](https://www.usnews.com/news/cities/articles/2020-06-11/how-much-the-10-largest-us-cities-spend-on-police):
How Much the 10 Largest U.S. Cities Spend on Police Police departments accounted for about 14% of total budget allocations in the 10 largest cities on average, ranging from 6% in New York to 17% in San Antonio.

Based on these sources:

<search>sworn police officer headcounts in 2024 top 10 most populous U.S. cities</search>

Police Employment, Officers Per Capita Rates for U.S. Cities Washington, D.C., and Chicago recorded the highest tallies of officers per capita among big cities reporting data to the FBI. In general, the ...

[Doc 2](https://ucr.fbi.gov/crime-in-the-u.s/2019/crime-in-the-u.s.-2019/topic-pages/police-employee-data):
FBI — Police Employee Data County agencies reported an average of 2.8 officers per 1,000 inhabitants. (See Table 71.) Sworn officers accounted for 69.5 percent of all law enforcement ...

[Doc 3](https://www.policeforum.org/trending5jul25):
PERF survey shows police staffing increased slightly in 2024 but still ... Those from medium-sized agencies (50-249 sworn officers) reported their staffing levels rose 3.6 percent during 2024. They employed 3.5 percent ...

Now, let's compile the data:

<search>top 10 most populous U.S. cities FY 2024 violent crime rate 2023 homicide population 2020 Census</search>

Search query: top 10 most populous U.S. cities FY 2024 violent crime rate 2023 homicide population 2020 Census
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.rit.edu/liberalarts/sites/rit.edu.liberalarts/files/docs/CPSI%20Working%20Papers/2025-02_CPSI%20Working%20Paper_US%20City%20Homicide%20Stats.pdf):
[PDF] 2024 Homicide Statistics for 24 U.S. Cities In the 2023 homicide report, New. Orleans was estimated to have a 2023 homicide rate of 53.8, which placed the city at the top of the list; New Orleans was ...

[Doc 2](https://usafacts.org/articles/which-cities-have-the-highest-murder-rates/):
Which cities have the highest murder rates? - USAFacts Cook County, Illinois, home to Chicago and its metropolitan area, had 805 homicides in 2023 — the most in the nation. The second highest was Los ...

[Doc 3](https://www.security.org/resources/most-dangerous-cities/):
Which U.S. Cities Are the Most Dangerous? - Security.org Anniston, AL tops the most dangerous U.S. cities list with 3434 violent crimes per capita. East St. Louis, IL has the highest murder rate.
